comments.body: The azalea trees need to and no other tree because you are supposed to find an azalea tree, dig down, and follow the rooted dirt to the lush caves and that is the only way to find one unless you don‚Äôt do it on purpose

I have similar ideas and reasons behind this. Also it should be noted that the Lush Caves are found almost directly under an Azalea tree, so you just look for those. The small amount of rooted dirt would make farming and mining in forest more difficult, with rooted dirt requiring double hoeing, and being much more difficult to dig through with fist or shovel (maybe stone tier shovel required). This would force players to choose optimal terrain for different things, farming more heavily on plains (which is already easier) and mining more in plains and mountains.
Actually I think it's just the tree that signifies a lush caves, and the roots are just decorative. I'd love to see this feature in game.
I've loved this idea since the rooted dirt block came out
It's strange that only azalea has roots, it would be more logical to add them under all trees
Dripstone bricks, chiseled dripstone, dripstone columns, polished dripstone and dripstone tiles.
This is actually a really great idea, a brown-ish stone variant of blocks will fit really great in some awesome builds
I agree! They should also make Dripstone walls, Dripstone tiles, and make it so you can convert Dripstone blocks into pointed Dripstone using a stone cutter!

came here just to suggest this! as a builder i love the wide selection of whites greys and blacks, but there's practically no browns outside of wood. i really love the color of dripstone and would love dripstone bricks.

It would be particularly nice to have them sized to match with the bricks/nether bricks, as it's really common to have multiple shades of bricks used within the same building for masonry. Not that I'd mind if they were sized to stone bricks either, a nice brown brick is always nice.

Beat me to it, just made my own dripstone bricks for a resource pack and it would honestly be such a great addition imo. The closest thing we have to proper tan blocks would be exposed copper, but even then it's use is limited. Considering what they did with basalt and deepslate, having more dripstone options feels like a natural addition.
Cool idea, but it just one use and not that helpful
Salt already exists on education edition
I have i post about salt too
It could also be sprinkled on blocks to stop plant growth until the block is either dug up and put back down (equivalent to turning over the dirt) or washed to flush out the salt.
Maybe salt could be used in cooking recipes to increase the nutritional value of meat and vegetables.

so bone and coal/charcoal
I‚Äôm a Java player and I also want things you have in bedrock. The potions and mixable colors in cauldrons, and the falling snow is too cool.

Yes, bedrock will get the same things as java! I hate when people ask this. Just because the java snapshots are released earlier doesnt mean caves and cliffs will never ever never be coming to bedrock. Everything else you said is irrelevent to this category.

 

Also c&c is coming out in 2021 but im sure that was just a typo

First of all, Piglin bartering is exactly the same between Java and Bedrock except for spectral arrows, you just aren't experimenting enough. Other things you mentioned are actual disparities. Second, the developers are always working towards parity. There are two seperate teams for developing Bedrock and Java design, so that's why there are a lot of differences. Lately, however, they have been working more than ever on bringing the versions close together and making them virtually the same. The Nether Update was released almost on the same date on all platforms, so you can only expect it to be like that from now on. With this post you're just basically spamming the website with all of the disparities you can think of. I assure you they have almost all of these things in mind. Bedrock also has some advantages, like way better loot from Raids and an actually challenging Wither.

I want all the java features to bedrock aswell like the fact that you cant hold every item in your off hand or that you only have access to 6 servers and hypixel (the biggest and best server in my opinion) isnt one of them is kinda sad I just want to play some of the minigame they have there

Yes!! I loved the Howling Peaks DLC because it just looks so cool!! I would love if there was a new biome variant of mountains called red mountains and that is where these are found. Also I would like it more if there was illagers there reusing the abandoned temple, just like in the DLC. There could be unique rewards like those from Minecraft Dungeons. Also, I think more of the Minecraft Dungeons Missions should inspire a new biome or structure. For example, what if there was also a new jungle variant like the Jungle Awakens DLC? Anyway, you have my vote.

yay, and maybe my idea 'The Forgotten One' could be a mob found there but...it needs votes
this would be really cool if it were added correctly
This should also be able to be triggered by falling blocks, jumping from at least three blocks, mining a block or tnt and creeper explosions.

I think it's a great idea, but would make the powdered snow turn into snowball items when blowing the horn. No need to do complicated coding to turn it into a gravity block and look 2 y-levels etc.. Just thinking we don't need to complicate the developers live too much üòâ
I think in an avalanche, if there is any ice, it should also temporarily become a gravity block and fall with the snow. If you got hit by ice, it would cause more damage than the snow would.

Absolutely love this idea and I think they could implement it like this:

-Goat horn has an avalanche triggering effect 15 block radius surrounding the player 

-All powdered snow in that area will temporarily turn into a liquid for 3 seconds, before turning into ice (so you can't keep pressing the horn and triggering several avalanches). This would actually cause the player to move- like an actual avalanche would.

-The liquid will act sort of like lava, where it flows and will move the player. But instead of fire damage, the liquid would give you the freezing effect. 

-Having leather boots on will negate this effect, sort of like Frost-Walker. 

Great idea!
I think it would be easier and cooler if the noise of the horn made the nearby stalactites fall.
With new types of villagers like dwarves, goblins, trolls, etc ya know? There's no reason for them squidward nosed cheapskate villagers to live in caves so something new üòÑ
Yes! This needs to be in the game

I love the idea, however, we've all seen how bad villages are at generating in relatively flat areas. there will be new issues that arise when villages generate in mountains. (aka, houses that are literally one hundred some blocks below the rest).

Cave villages might work out though, and I'd love to see them.

Cave. Villages.
This has to happen.

I think that would make the deep dark caves more dramatic, especially when you're trying to go past the warden unnoticed. It's great too because there will likely be more valuable ores near the bottom of the world, but only the bravest players will go down there because of both the warden AND the void fog. So that means greater risk and greater reward.
yeah with the void fog minecraft was a little creepy but the adventure was amazing

I never understood why they remove it, it was one of the best atmospheric things there was, when you were new it was really suspenseful because I did not know what was going to happen, with the sounds of the caves and more with the new update it would be great but a few cried and instead of giving the option to deactivate, mojang simply removed it...

I think This Idea paired with My Idea of Deep Dark specific Mobs would definitely be something. (The Idea I had for said mobs can be found here: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360076930611-The-deep-dark-could-use-more-Life.)

In fact, maybe any mob that originates from the deep dark could scare any mobs aside from bosses and creepers. When a creeper Is In the deep dark, It will Gladly Look for a watcher to wear as a hat, making the terrifying Creeper jockey, In which the creeper will then chase after other mobs, Allowing the watcher to lay waste to them. Meanwhile when a warden is nearby, It will gladly walk out of It's way, with the creeper stand still, maybe shivering, and the watcher looking at the warden emotionlessly, reassuring them that they're safe (Kind of wholesome, honestly). This Is to signify that the creeper Isn't like the other mobs, and that These plant-like mobs would gladly Get along with the monsters of the Moss-like sculk, while also giving players and mobs alike a fear they never felt before.

meanwhile Scourges will gladly feed off of zombies, skeletons, and witches; (although not other Insect mobs), grabbing them with their mandibles and leeching their life force until they are dead. this could also signify how the scourges are also a major threat, and that If you aren't careful, you could end up like them.
I really like this idea!

It shouldn't just be the new tiers, it should have more nuance.
A copper shield could be less durable then normal shield, but recovers from stuns faster.

An auto crossbow could occasionally jam, and require a longer load time the next time loaded.

Maybe the regular crossbow, being simple in design, is far easier to enchant then the others, and the others have trouble using rockets (Auto crossbow mechanisms are made for arrows, and the heavy crossbow has too much kick for a thing that is self propelled.)

dungeons aren't supposed to look like dungeons. they're called monster rooms in their ID

Allow me to re-Introduce this very suggestion:

Believe it or not, we have no dungeons in minecraft, but rather small "Monster rooms" that really aren't up to date. It would be nice if the monster rooms were renamed as "Crypts" in 1.18, along with the introduction of some ACTUAL dungeons in the form of a "Necropolis". The necropolis could work as a large underground Tomb, a dungeon with gravestones (a new decoration that can summon undead mobs if infused with certain items while left in the dark) and various chests littered around. multiple rooms would surround the Necropolis, leading up to later rooms which contain a new mob: The paladin

the paladin would be a Undead Knight who's body is covered in stone armor, giving It as much defense as iron, while sporting a hearty 75 HP. They would always either be carrying a sword or axe alongside a shield, which they will use when a player runs at them. By killing the Paladin, they will drop the stone their armor was made out of (which could be stone, deepslate, or Calacite), their shield, 10-13 XP, and occasionally their weapon (may be enchanted).
